description.narrative: Empowering women in participation in public administration and socio-economic life

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Indicator 1.1. Share of innovative policies, models and tools on the advancement of women in public service and in sectors of economy that were tested and approved by national partner for scaling up (%)
Indicator 1.2. Draft legislative documents on gender equality, women empowerment that are in line with international standards are available.
Indicator 1.3. Share of participants from Women’s Committee, MELR, State Statistics Committee, khokimiyats who apply at their work knowledge and skills gained through trainings, conferences, workshops on gender equality and women empowerment
Indicator 1.4. Number of practical and methodological manuals on women empowerment and gender statistics prepared by the project.

comment.narrative:
1.1Support, assistance to analysis / monitoring of the activities of 2 Centers for the Rehabilitation and Adaptation of Victims of Violence and the Prevention of Suicides. 1.2.Collection of data and assessment of existing gaps and barriers in access to justice services for women and girls. 1.3. Designing and supporting the provision of key services in selected pilot locations, including ProBono legal aid / legal aid, courts and informal justice mechanisms. 1.4. Support of Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the creation of One Pilot Center in the regions of Uzbekistan for girls/young women to expand their rights and opportunities in the field of STEM. 1.5.Support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the development of a mobile application for mobile phones to raise public awareness on gender, gender based violence, healthcare of women and information on existing services for victims of GBV. 1.6.Organize the international conference “Empowering women in public administration, as well as in the field of STEM” to promote high-level gender equality. 1.7. Development of promo materials to raise public awareness on gender issues, women in justice and the prevention of harassment and violence against women. 1.8. Organization of trainings, round tables on gender issues, STEM, gender expertise of legislation and gender-based violence, discussions with womens NGOs and legal experts on gender-based violence.
2.1. Assistance in the development of a draft methodology for conducting gender-legal expertise of national legislation. 2.2. Assistance to develop amendments to the legislation in connection with the adopted Laws “ On protection of women from harassment and violence” and “On guarantees of equal rights and equal opportunities for men and women”. 2.3. Assistance to the conducting Gender expertise of national legislation based on the draft methodology on conducting gender expertise. 2.4. Preparation of the analytical report “Crimes committed by women: causes and ways of elimination”. 2.5. Preparation of an analytical report statistics on domestic violence, dis-aggregated by age and relationship between victim and perpetrator. 2.6. Preparation of an analytical report according to the empowerment of women in public administration, as well as in the field of STEM
3.1 Provide support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in collecting and maintaining statistics on harassment and violence against women. 3.2.Support for updating the government portal gender.stat.uz and releasing gender-disaggregated data across the sector for decision making, regulatory impact assessment, strategic planning, institutional development, and progress monitoring. 3.3. Support Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in organizing interactive online courses to provide online training for womens NGOs and NGOs working with violence, STEM. 3.4.Design and implement legal empowerment initiatives such as legal literacy programs through legal assistants and self-help groups. 3.5.Support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the creation of a Media Center for working with the media. 3.6. Organization of study tours to a foreign countries in order to exchange experiences on the effective work of gender equality, temporary special measures, social inclusive services for women in rural areas. 3.7. To teach developers of legislation to conduct gender expertise of legislation, to inculcate skills for conducting gender expertise.

1.1. As a technical support 15 laptops, one projector procured and provided to shelter workers. Also, 21 tablets were provided to women inspectors of shelters of Ministry of Internal Affairs to streamline interaction with victims of GBV. Also, 550 winter clothing for victims of violence in shelters and people with disabilities. Trainings to employees from 14 regional shelters was provided on medical support, legal and psychological support to victims of GBV, as well as the use of e-journal on collecting statistics of GVB cases. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020; OL from Ministry of Mahalla and Family Support. 1.2. An e-Journal was developed to help national counterpart to maintain statistics of domestic violence. The software helps to collect and analyze gender statistics from 197 shelters. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020; 1.3. an online mobile clinic to provide legal and psychological consultations for women and people with disabilities (with the help of a sign translation) on TV (Uzreport), radio, social networks (Telegram - Azizam channel). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.4. The joint project provided technical support to the opening of a STEM center in Tashkent region as part of a new project to improve computer literacy of people with disabilities (deaf and hearing impaired girls and youth). The project is implemented jointly with a local NGO “Mehr Kuzda”. Also, the draft Presidential Resolution “On measures to empower girls and women in the development of exact and technological sciences (STEM) has been developed; Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.5. A mobile app NAJOT was developed. The app provides access for women and girls in remote regions of Uzbekistan to information on issues such as hygiene during a pandemic, social issues in families, the promotion of women, gender equality, womens rights and opportunities, the rights of victims of violence, measures of legal protection for victims of violence. A mobile app “UZNTT” was developed. The app converts speech into sign language (surdo translation) for people with hearing disabilities. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.6. An international scientific and practical conference “Ideas and initiatives of young women in the development of science, education and the digital economy” was conducted. The Conference was dedicated to the discussion and development of recommendations in the field of protecting the rights and interests of women, as well as ensuring gender equality in the country based on scientifically sound proposals (more than 150 participants, including 10 foreign experts from the USA, Italy, India and Sweden). An international forum Raising the legal culture of women is an important factor in the development of the country , dedicated to the discussion of new mechanisms for the effective protection of women, role of law enforcement officers in protecting the rights and interests of women, increasing the socio-political activity of women, cooperation between state and public organizations to address family issues (more than 400 participants). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.7. Three video clips, 2 brochures, 3 flyers were prepared and distributed at drugstores. These promo materials were posted on social media in order to raise public awareness on women empowerment and GBV during the lockdown period. Also, as part of a 16-day campaign against gender-based violence the joint project initiated, implemented and conducted the following projects and events: - A webinar on “Effective assistance to the victims of domestic violence: the experience of Sweden” with the participation of Swedish experts for employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of Higher Education, the Ministry of Health, the Academy of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Bar Association, and employees of the Republican Center for Rehabilitation; - An online mobile clinic to provide legal and psychological consultations for women and people with disabilities (with the help of a sign translation) on TV (Uzreport), radio, social networks (Telegram - Azizam channel); - Launch of a mobile application Najot” to support the protection of rights of GBV victims and survivors and provision of timely assistance and access to information; - Launch of a “positive masculinity” campaign to raise awareness of gender-based violence among the general public: videos featuring religious leaders, publication and distribution of booklets, brochures and leaflets containing information on gender-based violence and womens rights; - A national contest Gender Equality Activist with the participation of representatives of ministries, departments, non-governmental organizations and journalists, who achieved high results in the field of gender equality at the end of the year, came up with initiatives for the development of society, defended the rights of women and performed relevant tasks in their field. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.8. A series of trainings have been conducted on GBV prevention with the participation of international experts for employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and its Academy, Ministry of Higher Education, Ministry of Health, Association of Lawyers, Republican Center for Rehabilitation and 197 women shelters, as well as representatives of mahallas of all levels (over 1,500 people). An international scientific and practical conference “Ideas and initiatives of young women in the development of science, education and the digital economy” was conducted. The Conference was dedicated to the discussion and development of recommendations in the field of protecting the rights and interests of women, as well as ensuring gender equality in the country based on scientifically sound proposals (more than 150 participants, including 10 foreign experts from the USA, Italy, India and Sweden). Also, series of trainings, dedicated to the improvement of research and publishing skills of women scholars (over 50 women scholars and university professors) Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.1. The Governmental Resolution “On Conducting Gender-Legal Expertise of Acts and Their Projects” approved on March 30, 2020 by #192. Evidence: https://lex.uz/ru/docs/4777291 2.2. Draft amendments to two gender-laws on GBV and equal rights and opportunities for women and men were developed and submitted to national counterpart. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.3. The methodology for gender legal expertise of national legislation has been prepared. The Gender-legal examination of Labor Code, Criminal Code, and Civil Code has been conducted. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.4. The analytical report crimes committed by women: causes, ways of elimination was prepared. Analytical paper “ON causes and consequences of divorces among women in Uzbekistan” was prepared and submitted to national partner. The findings of analytical paper are to be served as a basis for a draft law “On Divorces” in 2021. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 2.5. The analytical report on domestic violence, disaggregated by age and relationship between victim and perpetrator was prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.6. The analysis of the best foreign practice and experience on empowering women in STEM was prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.1. An e-Journal was developed to help national counterpart to maintain statistics of domestic violence. The software helps to collect and analyze gender statistics from 197 shelters. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.2. Not implemented due to the COVID-19 related lockdown. 3.3. Eight video lessons on gender equality, women empowerment, harassment, gender based violence, women in justice was prepared and uploaded to the website of the Gender Commission of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Also, three paintings on women empowerment were prepared and submitted to National Partner in order to replicate them in the building in 2021 within street art concept. 3.4. The practical guideline for the provision of primary care (medical, psychological, social and legal assistance) to victims of violence in shelters has been prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.5. The Media Center was established with the support from the UNDP. Relevant specialists were attracted (editor, PR specialist, designer, translator, cameramen and other technical support staff). A laptop and a projector provided to the Media Center. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.6. Not implemented due to the COVID-19 related lockdown. 3.7. A series of trainings were conducted with the participation of international experts on gender expertise of normative legal acts and draft laws for representatives of both chambers of the Parliament (more than 150 participants took part in the training). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020.

1.1. UNDP WEP project facilitated the creation of pilot Women’s rehabilitation Centers/shelters (197 countrywide). Moreover, Legal clinics for Rural women were established in 4 regions: Kashkadarya, Surkhandarya, Khorezm, Karakalpakstan to provide legal services and support to women experiencing violence and other social issues. 1.2. UNDP WEP project facilitated a UN Taskforce and provided evidence-based comments and recommendations to facilitate the drafting of two gender-related laws “On guarantees of equal rights and opportunities for women and men” and Law “On protection of women from gender-based violence”, which were enacted in 2019 1.3. To promote knowledge sharing and awareness raising on GBV issues, UNDP has organized more than 10 trainings and round tables. More than 150 people (80 % are women) attended our capacity building trainings on leadership, gender-legal expertise, to gain skills to work with victims of violence and GBV. In addition, 50 women-officers of Ministry of Internal Affairs were trained to gain skills to work with victims of violence. Training on gender-legal expertise in regard of compliance of local legislation on women empowerment with the best international standards was carried out for the members of Parliament, candidates to deputy of Legislative Chamber for the first time in Uzbekistan. For the first time in Uzbekistan, on December 2, 2019, a dialogue “Step towards an equal world: Prevent. Protect. Empower” dedicated to the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women (25th of November) was held with participation of high-level representatives of government. 1.4. Knowledge materials, infographics on GBV and PSA on prevention of violence were produced and disseminated widely.The following knowledge products were developed and circulated among national partners: - Manual for future women leaders. - Concept note and target recommendations on organizing the activities of mobile legal clinics. - Dozens of study materials and manuals on gender-based issues were developed and shared as part of organized training and workshops. - 6 promotional and tutorial videos on gender discrimination, violence against women were developed and widely circulated on media to raise public awareness on gender-based issues.

1.1. Share of innovative policies, models (i.e. STEM Labs) and tools on the advancement of women in public service and in sectors of economy that were tested and approved by national partner for scaling up (%) (Target: 30%). 1.2. Draft legislative documents on gender equality, women empowerment that are in line with international standards are available. (Target: 3 normative acts). 1.4. Share of women in managerial positions at public and private sectors. 1.5. Share of participants from MoMF, MELR, State Statistics Committee, khokimiyats who apply at their work knowledge and skills gained through trainings, conferences, workshops on gender equality and women empowerment. 1.6. Number of practical and methodological manuals on gender equality and women empowerment. (Target: 2).

1.1. - A STEM Center was created for girls with disabilities at the makhalla community centers. Over 50 participants received Certificates on basic computer literacy (2021). - International educational contest “TECHNOVATION Girls” was held, online trainings and master classes for young girls and boys were organized (2017-2021). Only in 2021: o Over 700 participants from 7 regions attended the contest o Over 41 projects of mobile applications were presented o 40 online trainings and master classes were held by 262 mentors o An Uzbek team was qualified to the semi-final round of the contest with an application “Rahmat”
- A special Center for vocational training was established in Syrdarya region. Over 1500 unemployed girls and women attended special trainings. Over 100 new job places were created for women. Technical support (purchase of equipment) was provided to selected enterprises led by women (production of macaroni and pasta products, hairdressing, sewing and etc.) (2021). - Over 50 gender indicators were developed and uploaded to the gender.stat.uz
1.2. The following laws and regulations were enacted: - Presidential Resolution “On additional measures to rehabilitate women victims of violence” (2021) - Governmental provision “On issuing the order of protection to women victims of harassment and violence, ensuring their implementation and monitoring” - Governmental provision “On the procedures for persons who have committed for persons who have committed or have a tendency to pressure and commit violence to undergo behavior correction programs” (2021)
The following legal documents were drafted: - The Gender equality strategy of Uzbekistan 2030; - Draft Presidential Resolution “On measures to empower girls and women in the development of exact and technological sciences (STEM) - Draft legal act “On family divorces” - Draft Presidential Resolution “On measures to further improve the system of supporting women, ensuring their active participation in society” - Draft State program for training women for leadership positions in the Republic of Uzbekistan for 2021-2030 to further support the promotion of talented women.
1.5. Material and technical support was provided to the Ministry for Support of Mahalla and Family, particularly: - A media center was developed to organize regular coverage of the Ministry’s activities in Media - Ministry’s website was created - IT equipment was purchased to integrate e-Doc system - Over 1000 employees of the Ministry attended trainings and workshops on the use of e-Doc system
The following conferences, trainings and workshops, trips were organized: International Conference “Virtual dialogue on the role of women-police officers in Central Asia”, with the participation of over 200 representatives of regional organizations and national agencies of Central Asia (2021) - In collaboration with the psychological club “Azizam” (2021): o 8 trainings on such topics as “Development of women”, “Role of women in a family and society”, “Violence prevention”, “Happy mother and daughter” were conducted for over 350 women from Tashkent, Samarkand and Khorezm o Over 150 psychological consultations with women in Tashkent region were conducted. - Webinar on psychological instruments to work with victims of gender violence - Two online broadcasting in Instagram channels with a famous psychologist on the following topics “Prevention of violence against women”, “Psychology of men and women” - Over 4 video materials on various gender issues were developed and widely distributed in social media (Instagram, Facebook, Telegram)
1.6. The following practical and methodological manuals were developed: - Methodology for gender legal expertise of national legislation; - Practical guidelines for the provision of primary care (medical, psychological, social and legal assistance) to victims of violence in women shelters.
